Wisdom: الْمُوَاصِلُ لِلدُّنْيَا مَقْطُوعٌ
enWisdom: The one who is attached to this world is cut off [from Allah]

Wisdom: النَّاسُ طَالِبَانِ طَالِبٌ وَمَطْلُوبٌ فَمَنْ طَلَبَ الدُّنْيَا طَلَبَهُ الْمَوْتُ حَتَّى يُخْرِجَهُ عَنْهَا وَمَنْ طَلَبَ الْآخِرَةَ طَلَبَتْهُ الدُّنْيَا حَتَّى يَسْتَوْفِيَ رِزْقَهُ مِنْهَا
enWisdom: People are divided into two types of seekers, and each seeker is also sought after; so whoever seeks this world is sought after by death until it takes him out from it, and whoever seeks the Hereafter is sought after by this world, until he gets his sustenance from it in full

Wisdom: اذْكُرْ مَعَ كُلِّ لَذَّةٍ زَوَالَهَا وَمَعَ كُلِّ نِعْمَةٍ انْتِقَالَهَا [أَثْقَالَهَا] وَمَعَ كُلِّ بَلِيَّةٍ كَشْفَهَا فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ أَبْقَى لِلنِّعْمَةِ وَأَنْفَى [أَتْقَى‏] لِلشَّهْوَةِ وَأَذْهَبُ لِلْبَطَرِ وَأَقْرَبُ إِلَى الْفَرَجِ وَأَجْدَرُ بِكَشْفِ الْغُمَّةِ وَدَرْكِ الْمَأْمُولِ
enWisdom: With every pleasure remember its [eventual] end, and with every blessing [recall] its removal, and with every hardship its [ultimate] relief; for indeed this makes the blessings last longer, subdues lustful desires more, takes vanity further away, brings relief closer, and is more conducive for the relieving of distress and attainment of aspirations

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ أَقْبَلْتَ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا أَدْبَرَتْ
enWisdom: Indeed, if you approach this world you have turned your back [from the Hereafter]

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ أَدْبَرْتَ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا أَقْبَلَتْ
enWisdom: Indeed, when you turn your back on this world, you have approached [the Hereafter]

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ ذِي طُمَأْنِينَةٍ إِلَى الدُّنْيَا قَدْ صَرَعَتْهُ
enWisdom: How many a person who had confidence in this world has been struck down by it!

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ وَاثِقٍ بِالدُّنْيَا قَدْ فَجَعَتْهُ
enWisdom: How many a person who relied upon this world has been made to suffer by it!

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ شَقِيٍّ حَضَرَهُ أَجَلُهُ وَهُوَ مُجِدٌّ فِي الطَّلَبِ
enWisdom: How many a wretched person has been visited by his death while he is striving to acquire [worldly gain]

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاعَى الدُّنْيَا فَاتَتْهُ [لِلدُّنْيَا فَاتَتْهُ‏]
enWisdom: One who strives for this world is eluded by it

Wisdom: مَنْ قَعَدَ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا طَلَبَتْهُ
enWisdom: One who holds back from this world is sought by it

Wisdom: مَنْ صَارَعَ الدُّنْيَا صَرَعَتْهُ
enWisdom: One who wrestles this world is knocked down by it

Wisdom: مَنْ عَصَى الدُّنْيَا أَطَاعَتْهُ
enWisdom: One who disobeys this world is obeyed by it

Wisdom: مَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا أَتَتْهُ
enWisdom: One who turns away from this world is approached by it

Wisdom: مَنْ تَشَاغَلَ بِالزَّمَانِ شَغَلَهُ
enWisdom: One who busies himself with [the worldly activities of his] lifetime becomes occupied by it [and pays no heed to the Hereafter]

Wisdom: مَنْ كَابَدَ الْأُمُورَ هَلَكَ
enWisdom: One who suffers the severity of matters is destroyed

Wisdom: مَنْ سَلَا عَنِ الدُّنْيَا أَتَتْهُ رَاغِمَةً
enWisdom: One who thinks little of this world, it comes to him humiliated

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَقَلَّ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا اسْتَكْثَرَ مِمَّا يُؤْمِنُهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks less of this world gains more of that which keeps him secure [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَكْثَرَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا اسْتَكْثَرَ مِمَّا يُوبِقُهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks more of this world gains more of that which will ruin him

Wisdom: مَنْ رَغِبَ فِيهَا أَتْعَبَتْهُ وَأَشْقَتْهُ
enWisdom: One who desires it [this world], it troubles him and makes him wretched

Wisdom: مَنْ قَعَدَ عَنْ طَلَبِ الدُّنْيَا قَامَتْ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Whoever keeps back from seeking this world, it rises towards him

Wisdom: مَنْ عَتَبَ عَلَى الدَّهْرِ طَالَ مَعْتَبُهُ
enWisdom: One who blames [the vicissitudes of] time, his blame will be lengthy

Wisdom: مَنْ لَهِيَ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا هَانَتْ عَلَيْهِ الْمَصَائِبُ
enWisdom: One who turns his attention away from this world, hardships become easy for him [to bear]

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسْرَفَ فِي طَلَبِ الدُّنْيَا مَاتَ فَقِيراً
enWisdom: One who exceeds the limits in seeking this world dies a pauper

Wisdom: مَنْ حَسُنَ ظَنُّهُ بِالدُّنْيَا تَمَكَّنَتْ مِنْهُ الْمِحْنَةُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: مَنْ ظَفِرَ بِالدُّنْيَا نَصِبَ وَمَنْ فَاتَتْهُ تَعِبَ
enWisdom: One who triumphs in this world becomes troubled and one whom it eludes gets distressed

Wisdom: مَنْ عَانَدَ الزَّمَانَ أَرْغَمَهُ وَمَنِ اسْتَسْلَمَ إِلَيْهِ لَمْ يَسْلَمْ
enWisdom: One who resists time is compelled by it and one who submits to it is not safe [from it]

Wisdom: مَنْ خَدَمَ الدُّنْيَا اسْتَخْدَمَتْهُ وَمَنْ خَدَمَ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ خَدَمَتْهُ
enWisdom: Whoever serves this world, it exploits him and whoever serves Allah, the Glorified, it (this world) serves him

Wisdom: مَنْ عَتَبَ عَلَى الدَّهْرِ طَالَ مَعْتَبُهُ
enWisdom: One who blames [the vicissitudes of] time, his blame will be lengthy

Wisdom: مَنْ عَطَفَ عَلَيْهِ اللَّيْلُ وَالنَّهَارُ أَبْلَيَاهُ
enWisdom: One whose nights and days pass him by is made old by them

Wisdom: مَا يُعْطَى الْبَقَاءَ مَنْ أَحَبَّهُ
enWisdom: Perpetuity is not granted to [any] one who loves [and wishes for] it

Wisdom: مَثَلُ الدُّنْيَا كَظِلِّكَ إِنْ وَقَفْتَ وَقَفَ وَإِنْ طَلَبْتَهُ بَعُدَ
enWisdom: The similitude of this world is like your shadow, if you stop it stops and if you seek it, it moves further away

Wisdom: لَا تَعْصِمُ الدُّنْيَا مَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهَا
enWisdom: This world does not protect the one who seeks refuge in it

Wisdom: كُلُّ مَخْلُوقٍ يَجْرِي إِلَى مَا لَا يَدْرِي
enWisdom: Every creation is moving towards that which it has no knowledge of
